questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription and use Microsoft Intune.

You need to deploy new Android devices as shown in the following table.

//IMG//


Which enrollment profile should you use for each device? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
device 3 is corporate-owned devices with work profile
ref: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/enrollment/android-dedicated-devices-fully-managed-enroll#:~:text=After%20you%27ve%20set%20up%20your%20Android%20Enterprise%20dedicated%20devices%2C%20fully%20managed%20devices%2C%20or%20corporate%2Downed%20work%20profile%20devices%20in%20Intune%2C%20you%20can%20enroll%20the%20devices

Under this, you can see the QR enrollment method for these kinds of devices.

comments.content:
✅ Corporate-owned devices with work profile - For Device3
This enrollment profile supports both work and personal use on the same device while keeping work data separate from personal data. It also allows enrollment using a QR code, making it ideal for organizations that want to provide employees with company-owned devices that they can also use for personal purposes.

For Device3, why “Personally-owned devices with work profile” isn’t suitable?
• Device3 is corporate-owned: The prompt clearly states that all three devices are being deployed as part of the organization's Microsoft 365 E5 subscription, indicating they are corporate-owned.
• BYOD vs. Corporate-owned: “Personally-owned devices with work profile” is specifically for devices that employees own and bring to work. In this case, the organization is providing the devices, so a corporate-owned profile is necessary.

Key takeaway: When choosing an enrolment profile, it's crucial to consider who owns the device (the organization or the employee) as this determines the level of control and management the organization has over the device.

discussion.content:
device3 is Corporate-owned devices with work profile". see link bellow
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/enrollment/android-dedicated-devices-fully-managed-enroll
I think the given answer for Device 3 is wrong. QR code device provisioning is not supported for personally owned devices, the answer should instead be "Corporate-owned devices with work profile".

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription and use Microsoft Intune Suite.

The subscription contains devices enrolled in Intune as shown in the following table.

//IMG//


Which devices support Device query?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Windows devices must be Microsoft Entra joined or Microsoft Entra hybrid joined.

Workplace joined or Microsoft Entra registered devices aren't supported.

Selected Answer: A
Device query in Microsoft Intune is currently only supported on corporate-owned Windows 10 or later devices that are Microsoft Entra joined. Based on the given information:
1. Device1 (Windows 10, Microsoft Entra Joined) is the only device that meets all the criteria for Device query support.
2. Device2 (Windows 11, Microsoft Entra Registered) is not eligible because it is registered rather than joined to Microsoft Entra ID.
3. Device3 (iOS) and Device4 (Android) are not supported for Device query, as the feature is limited to Windows device.

Selected Answer: A
A. I would of lean to B but MS says "To use Device query, devices must be Intune managed and corporate owned" and this ruled out REGISTERED devices.

Selected Answer: A
ONLY JOINED DEVICES

To use Device query, devices must be Intune managed and corporate owned (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/analytics/device-query). Only Windows 10 and later. 
So answer is Device1 only.

I suppose 1 and 2
Prerequisites
To use Device query in your tenant, you must have a license that includes Microsoft Intune Advanced Analytics. Advanced Analytics features are available with:
The Intune Advanced Analytics Add-on
Microsoft Intune Suite
To use Device query on a device, the device must be enrolled in Endpoint Analytics. Learn how to enroll a device in Endpoint Analytics.
You cannot opt out of cloud notifications (WNS)
For a user to use Device query, you must assign the Managed Devices - Query permission to them.
To use Device query, devices must be Intune managed and corporate owned.
Supported platforms
Device query is currently only supported on devices running Windows 10 and later.

To use Device query on a device, the device must be enrolled in Endpoint Analytics.
"Enrolled".

Why not 2 also.

Prerequisites
To use Device query in your tenant, you must have a license that includes Microsoft Intune Advanced Analytics. Advanced Analytics features are available with:

The Intune Advanced Analytics Add-on
Microsoft Intune Suite

Selected Answer: B
Device query requires the Intune ADVANCED Analytics add-on or Microsoft Intune Suite
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/analytics/device-query

With Microsoft E5, you get Microsoft Intune Plan 1, which is not enough for Advanced Analytics.
https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/security/business/microsoft-intune-pricing#:~:text=Microsoft%20Intune%20Advanced%20Analytics

None of these are included in E5, so you need to purchase the add-on to minimize the cost.

comments.content:
While Advanced Analytics is required for on-demand information.

"Device query allows you to quickly gain on-demand information about the state of your devices. When you enter a query on a selected device, Device query runs a query in real time. The data returned can then be used to respond to security threats, troubleshoot the device, or make business decisions.

Prerequisites
To use Device query in your tenant, you must have a license that includes Microsoft Intune Advanced Analytics. Advanced Analytics features are available with:
The Intune Advanced Analytics Add-on
Microsoft Intune Suite "

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/analytics/device-query#:~:text=Device%20query%20allows%20you%20to%20quickly%20gain%20on%2Ddemand%20information%20about%20the%20state%20of%20your%20devices.

" Microsoft Intune Advanced Analytics
A set of analytics-driven capabilities that help IT admins understand, anticipate, and improve end-user experiences.
Available as an add-on £3.80 "

Ref:
https://www.microsoft.com/en-gb/security/business/microsoft-intune-pricing#:~:text=Microsoft%20Intune%20Advanced,end%2Duser%20experiences.

Please follow the next comment.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Correct answer is B (Purchase the Intune Advanced Analytics add-on).

E5 subscription include "Endpoint Analytics" but not "Advanced Analytics" which is required for Device query to provide on-demand information.

" Microsoft Intune core capabilities:
- Cross-platform endpoint management
- Built-in endpoint security
- Mobile application management
- Endpoint analytics
- Microsoft Configuration Manager2 "

Ref:
https://www.microsoft.com/en-gb/security/business/microsoft-intune-pricing#:~:text=Microsoft%20Intune%20core,Configuration%20Manager2

Please follow the next comment.

Selected Answer: B
Prerequisites
To use Device query in your tenant, you must have a license that includes Microsoft Intune Advanced Analytics. Advanced Analytics features are available with:

The Intune Advanced Analytics Add-on
Microsoft Intune Suite

To use Device query for on-demand information about the state of devices enrolled in Microsoft Intune while minimizing costs, you should first onboard the devices to Endpoint analytics. This is because:
• Device query requires devices to be enrolled in Endpoint Analytics as a prerequisite.
• The Microsoft 365 E5 subscription already includes Microsoft Intune Plan 1, which provides core endpoint management capabilities (Endpoint Analytics).
• To use Device query, you need either the Intune Advanced Analytics Add-on or the Microsoft Intune Suite. However, purchasing additional add-ons would not minimize costs.
• Onboarding devices to Endpoint analytics is a necessary step that doesn't incur additional licensing costs, making it the most cost-effective first action.
Therefore, the correct answer is option d: Onboard the devices to Endpoint analytics.

Selected Answer: B
You require either Intune Suite or advanced analytics add-ons. Advanced analytics is cheaper

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/analytics/device-query#:~:text=To%20use%20Device%20query%20in,Microsoft%20Intune%20Suite

Selected Answer: B
Prerequisites
To use Device query in your tenant, you must have a license that includes Microsoft Intune Advanced Analytics. To use Device query on a device, the device must be enrolled in Endpoint Analytics.

Selected Answer: D
Advanced Analytics is not needed, so D correct.

Selected Answer: D
a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription does not include the Intune Advanced Analytics add-on by default. While Microsoft 365 E5 provides advanced capabilities such as Endpoint Analytics and Defender for Endpoint, the Intune Advanced Analytics add-on is a separate subscription that offers additional analytics and automation features not included in the base Intune offering. So to minimize cost, you can use basic Endpoint Analytics features (such as Device Query) without purchasing the add-on.

Selected Answer: B
Prerequisites
To use Device query in your tenant, you must have a license that includes Microsoft Intune Advanced Analytics. Advanced Analytics features are available with:
The Intune Advanced Analytics Add-on
Microsoft Intune Suite
To use Device query on a device, the device must be enrolled in Endpoint Analytics. Learn how to enroll a device in Endpoint Analytics.

Confusing, not sure which one is cost saving

comments.content: Advanced analytics add-on is cheaper, I think that's the correct answer. The question asks for a solution that minimize costs. Onboarding devices to Endpoint Analytics is something general, not related to cost.
Onboarding the devices doesn't do anything if you don't have the necessary license for the analytics though.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
correct

Selected Answer: D
B is partially correct, but you need to purchase as add on. The question is minimize cost, D Since your goal is to minimize costs, onboarding the devices to Endpoint analytics (Option D) is a more cost-effective solution. Endpoint analytics is included with your existing Microsoft 365 E5 subscription and provides valuable insights into device performance and health without the need for extra purchases

Selected Answer: B
B looks correct then you onboard in Endpoint analytics

To use Device query in your tenant, you must have a license that includes Microsoft Intune Advanced Analytics. Advanced Analytics features are available with:

The Intune Advanced Analytics Add-on
Microsoft Intune Suite

B correct
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/analytics/device-query

Microsoft Intune Suite

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that contains devices enrolled in Microsoft Intune.

You plan to use Device query to provide on-demand information about the state of the devices. The solution must minimize costs.

What should you do first?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Device must be Entra ID joined and Intune Enrolled.

"Requirements
Endpoint Privilege Management has the following requirements:
- Microsoft Entra joined or Microsoft Entra hybrid joined.
- Microsoft Intune Enrollment or Microsoft Configuration Manager co-managed devices (no workload requirements).
- Supported Operating System.
- Clear line of sight (without SSL-Inspection) to the required endpoints.

Note:
- Windows 365 (CloudPC) is supported using a supported operating system version
- Workplace-join devices are not supported by Endpoint Privilege Management
- Azure Virtual Desktop is not supported by Endpoint Privilege Management"

Ref:
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/protect/epm-overview#prerequisites:~:text=on%20capabilities.-,Requirements,Azure%20Virtual%20Desktop%20is%20not%20supported%20by%20Endpoint%20Privilege%20Management,-Endpoint%20Privilege%20Management

Selected Answer: A
Endpoint Privilege Management (EPM) has the following requirements:
1. Device must be running Windows 10 or Windows 11 – Device1, Device2, and Device3 qualify. Device4 (Android) is not supported.
2. Device must be Microsoft Entra Joined or Microsoft Entra Hybrid Joined – Device1 and Device2 qualify. Device3 and Device4 are only Microsoft Entra Registered, which is not supported.
3. Device must be enrolled in Microsoft Intune – Device1 and Device3 qualify. Device2 is not enrolled in Intune, making it ineligible.

Thus, only Device1 meets all requirements for EPM implementation.

Selected Answer: A
Given answer is correct
Applies to: Windows 10 /Windows 11
Endpoint Privilege Management has the following requirements:

Microsoft Entra joined or Microsoft Entra hybrid joined
Microsoft Intune Enrollment or Microsoft Configuration Manager co-managed devices (no workload requirements)
Supported Operating System
Clear line of sight (without SSL-Inspection) to the required endpoints
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/protect/epm-overview

Given answer is correct

Supported Operating System

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/protect/epm-overview

A: Correct
Requirements
Endpoint Privilege Management has the following requirements:

Microsoft Entra joined or Microsoft Entra hybrid joined
Microsoft Intune Enrollment or Microsoft Configuration Manager co-managed devices (no workload requirements)
Supported Operating System
Clear line of sight (without SSL-Inspection) to the required endpoints

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You have a Microsoft 365 ES subscription and use Microsoft Intune Suite.

You manage the following types of devices:

• Windows 11
• Android
• iOS

You need to implement Microsoft Tunnel for Mobile Application Management (MAM) to provide the devices with access to on-premises company apps.

What should you deploy first, and which device types can use Tunnel for MAM? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content: Correct.

correct
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/protect/microsoft-tunnel-mam#:~:text=When%20you%20use,iOS/iPadOS
